metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4909 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the tr_bitfieldEnsureNthBitAlloced function in bitfield.c in Transmission before 2.84 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted peer message, which triggers an out-of-bounds write.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

transmission - 2.82-1.1ubuntu3.1
transmission-cli - 2.82-1.1ubuntu3.1
transmission-common - 2.82-1.1ubuntu3.1
transmission-daemon - 2.82-1.1ubuntu3.1
transmission-gtk - 2.82-1.1ubuntu3.1
transmission-qt - 2.82-1.1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: transmission package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.82-1.1ubuntu3.1').
